author: chunqingchen
body:
- [x] Resolves issue #1357.
- [x] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [ ] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

Some of the cache location has been changed by other checkins. The fix is for the places haven't updated location yet.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
- Please make sure that you add a meaningful title per the [contribution guide](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-submission).  I have updated the title.  
- In the future, make sure you commit message are similarly meaningful
- Please make sure that you use the PR template per the same.  
  - [x] I've added the template, please fill it out.
- [ ] Please add tests to make sure this does not regress.  Per [Contribution Guide](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#common-engineering-practices)

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Please make sure you have completed all the tasks in [this comment](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/1668#issuecomment-237989723)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Most of the changes in this PR are simply reverting the formatting applied in #1591. Please remove those changes.

The changes to switch to XDG Cache are fine.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @chunqingchen GitHub is not recognizing the commits as yours. Please fix your email address.

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body:
@andschwa sorry i get confused. I've made no change about my email address. How do I fix it? by 
git config --global user.email ? I did submit my change on master by mistake yesterday. I switched to the correct branch and my major change won't highlighted then.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @chunqingchen - stack overflow is great for basic git questions, e.g. I searched on 'git fix author', and found this answer very useful: http://stackoverflow.com/a/1320317

title: Update the job cache location on on windows platforms
